text: Morning, im looking for some advice on hosting platforms, mainly AWS vs the rest. I am just about to start re-writing some of my services and was just wondering what peoples thoughts are on the best way to go. From what I understand if I go with AWS (rather then something like linode) im getting a large product/ feature set but in return paying higher costs and potentially slightly slower performance (from what ive read thus far). Is there any specific things around AWS and Betfair/betting that are also advantages of using it. From my understanding betfair are hosted on AWS? im pritty clueless when it comes to this stuff so would be interested in the techy guys thoughts.

elements.text: Morning, im looking for some advice on hosting platforms, mainly AWS vs the rest. From my understanding betfair are hosted on AWS? im pritty clueless when it comes to this stuff so would be interested in the techy guys thoughts.

text: Betfair aren’t in AWS

elements.text: Betfair aren’t in AWS

text: ah right must of dreamt that up in my head for some reason :man-facepalming:

elements.text: ah right must of dreamt that up in my head for some reason

text: AWS Dublin is close to the Betfair servers but it doesn’t help with the way their infrastructure is currently set up

elements.text: AWS Dublin is close to the Betfair servers but it doesn’t help with the way their infrastructure is currently set up

text: AWS maybe has an advantage in the number of users we have here that have experience with it. I’m sure there are more cost effective options out there but personally I’m too invested in AWS already and I don’t think they have the same track record (a few days ago there was a global Azure outage). Cheaper and better drop in replacements for AWS services would be ideal. Someone mentioned Cloudflare R2 recently which is supposed to do this for AWS S3

text: Disclaimer: I work for AWS, but do not speak for them here in an official capacity. Customers tend to think it's expensive but reserved instances, spot instance if you're able to use them, moving to Lambda if you can (so not paying for idle), can all cut costs.

elements.text: Disclaimer: I work for AWS, but do not speak for them here in an official capacity. Customers tend to think it's expensive but reserved instances, spot instance if you're able to use them, moving to Lambda if you can (so not paying for idle), can all cut costs.

text: Also, :+1: for Terraform, but CDK is not half bad these days :slightly_smiling_face:

Super random one, but I dont suppose anyone has gone about trying to flatten a market_book record into a flat single level wide structure (with hundreds of columns .....) . From what I can see in betfairutil I think it has functions for a price size per row rather then a wide (one column for each atb/atl price combination).
